communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Platforms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Agency’s request for proposal for FOIA platform and services, all bids submitted in response the to request for proposal, any statements of work submitted in connection to the request for proposal, and contract/agreement to provide the FOIA platform and services for the Agency. 

I am requesting this information on an expedited based for an article I am writing as a journalist about all agencies moving from FOIA Online to other platforms and services.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Davis

communications.subject: Thank you for submitting your foia.gov request
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting your FOIA request through FOIA.GOV to National Labor Relations Board! 
You can track the status of your request, communicate with the agency regarding this request, or search previously released documents in our reading room using the SecureRelease portal. If you do not already have a SecureRelease portal account you can sign-up (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) here, just make sure to use 153750-23850462@requests.muckrock.com when you sign up to gain access to your request details. (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) 

Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us, please email SecureRelease Support and a member of our team will be happy to assist. (https://www.securerelease.us/) 
 

Take care, 

 
SecureRelease™ Support (Contractor) 
securereleasepublicsupport@deloitte.com  Do NOT respond to this email. The SecureRelease™ Support desk is not operated by a FOIA Office or Agency personnel, and does not process requests--please do not send request details, supporting documentation, or other sensitive information to this inbox. Additionally, please note that SecureRelease™ Support is unable to provide updates concerning the processing, status, or timeline of requests, nor can we offer guidance with regard to agency procedures. For these inquiries, please contact the Agency or refer to their website.

title: CMS CMMI Communications regarding the RO-APM

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CMS CMMI Communications regarding the RO-APM
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Email communications from the CMS Innovation Center regarding the Radiation Oncology Model ("RO Model" or "RO-APM") from January 1st, 2019 to December 31st, 2021. Specifically, communications regarding the model development to or from Dr. Mark Reardon (Quality Lead, RO Model), Marcie O’Reilly (Team Lead, RO Model), Genevieve Kehoe (Pricing Methodology Lead, RO Model), Dr. Aileen Chen (Clinical Consultant), the American Society for Radiation Oncology ("ASTRO"), and Mathematica Policy Research.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Bill Roentgen

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: CMS CMMI Communications regarding the RO-APM
communications.communication:
Regarding CMS FOIA:  Control Number 090820227055 and PIN T3QD

Mr Tripline -

Thank you for your response. To narrow the scope of my request:

Within email communications from the CMS Innovation Center regarding the Radiation Oncology Model ("RO Model" or "RO-APM") from January 1, 2019 to December 31, 2021

1) More specifically, emails discussing the exclusion of "proton therapy" or "protons" from the RO-APM

2) More specifically, emails discussing the exclusion of "PPS-exempt" or "Prospective Payment System-exempt" institutions

3) More specifically, in the 3 month period of October 2021 to December 2021, emails discussing the delay of the model

Please let me know if that adequately narrows my request, or if you need further clarification!

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #090820227055
communications.communication:
Good morning -

I appreciate the consistency and effort this request took, this was a large number of emails on a complex topic.

I understand the redactions made through the FOIA exemptions, in particular, the (b)(6) redactions.

As is evident in the release, due to Exemption 5, the vast majority of this information is redacted (or was already publicly available).

Prior to filing an appeal, I would request consideration of the following:

1) On page 1258 of the PDF, while the email is from a CMS employee and appears to be exempt under (b)(5), it is actually a CMS employee forwarding an email she received from a member of the public on their opinion on interim information. As such, this would not fall under an exemption, as it is not a pre-decision opinion by CMS. Could this redaction be removed? This email is being forwarded by the CMS employee as an "FYI".

2) On page 234 of the PDF, an employee of CMS has received a copy from an outside organization of an article published in The Journal of Clinical Oncology (a journal and article available to the public). The (b)(5) redaction appears to be applied to the employees opinion on the article, not on internal decision making process. As the opinion is being rendered on a public document, and after contact initiated by an outside organization, could this redaction be removed?

After looking at the rest of the release, the other Exemption 5 redactions seem consistent, save for these two.

Again, I really appreciate this work. This was a huge number of files!

Thank you!

Control Number 090820227055 and PIN T3QD

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FTC: Justanswer.com
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An complaints about the company "Just Answer" located at: https://www.justanswer.com/

The company also utilizes the following domains:
https://www.justanswer.co.uk/
https://www.justanswer.de/
https://www.justanswer.es/
https://www.justanswer.jp/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Thank you
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). Someone from our office will reach out to you as soon as possible regarding the status of your request.

Sincerely,

The FTC FOIA Unit

communications.subject: FOIA-2023-01737 Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
WARNING:  The content of this email including any and all attachments may contain controlled information as described in 32 CFR Part 2002.

Dear Robert Delaware:



This correspondence acknowledges the receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated September 8, 2023 seeking documents regarding all complaints relating to "Just Answer".



You may check the status of your FOIA request by visiting http://www.ftc.gov/about-ftc/foia/foia-reading-rooms/track-your-foia-request.  This report is updated at the end of each month.  If you should have any questions regarding your request, please contact me at ahowe@ftc.gov<mailto:ahowe@ftc.gov>.  In any call or future correspondence concerning the request, please refer to the following case number FOIA-2023-01737
Best,
